intro: Echinospermum diffusum var. hispidum, commonly known as the hairy echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color and are arranged in clusters. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
